Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days while we roamed around Rome, Fantastic value and nice room. really enjoyed our stay. would highly recommend. Very close to Termini train station and metro...excellent connections.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good, but not that bad either.”
Reviews.Author: emiliebolduc11
Reviews.Content: This hostel wasn't that bad, but it had its problems. First, you check-in at one place and they tell you that your room is in a building 3 blocks away.... It isn't very well situated but it isn't that bad either (30 mins of walking to the city center). The beds were uncomfortable, it gave my friend sore neck. The bathrooms were okay, cleaner than the rooms which is not very common! It is a very quiet hostel so if you need to sleep, this is the right place. There is no kitchen or computers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: LemonHair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2009 and August 2010. The staff were friendly and the room was clean although not very modern. You'll have to check in at Hotel Des Artistes and then they'll show you to the hostel which is a 3 minute walk away. It's a great location as there is a metro station just around the corner. It's also really close to many restaurants, internet cafes and the Termini Station. I would definitely recommend this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice price, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen&Gemma
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for the money we paid. The rooms are ridiculously small but that is to be expected. Within walking distance of the train station and numerous other attractions. I would recommend this hotel to friends - probably wouldn't stay again as I’d prefer to check out what other hotels have to offer in other parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not clear of hostel location when booking”
Reviews.Author: iwander711
Reviews.Content: We booked through hostelworld.com and thought we would be staying in a central location near the train station in Roma. However, when we checked in, they said they were out of room in that particular building and tried to have us stay in a building much farther away, down a questionable alley right near an embassy with lots of soldiers walking around with machine guns! I would have felt more safe if my friend and I (2 single females) weren't the ONLY two people staying in the building. I quickly contacted the front desk and told them that our new placement was unacceptable, and they somehow found an open room in the building we originally booked. The place was clean, be be careful when you book that you know for sure where you are staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price. Very comfortable and not a bad location. The staff were very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: goodgoose610
Reviews.Content: Service was very good. Very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were basic but comfortable. Location wasn't bad, close to metro station and some sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good but stange location, massive room.”
Reviews.Author: kellierenshaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009 for 3 nights. You have to go to a hotel first that is just a few blocks away from the train station. Then the receptionist takes you another 3 or 4 blocks away to Carlito's way the hostel is more like apartments, in way that there is no reception located in the building, the room we got was massive! and really clean and comfortable. I think the rooms are non smoking which is a little annoying but the windows open nice and wide, the windows also have steel shutters! :o As we approached the building there is the french embassy on the corner (i think it was the French i didn't look into it) which is guarded by armed soldiers 24/7 so i guess its a pretty safe location, although the sight of the guns unnerved me some :) there didn't seem to be many guest when we stayed but it was October, and at least the place was quite! The bathrooms were clean and fresh towels and tolitries are provided in your room everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Yay!”
Reviews.Author: dichohecho
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time staying in Carlito's Way. Decent beds, excellent showers. No AC but a fan. Near Termini station, ok to find, make sure you take a map. Roof terrrace, friendly bar across the road. Supermarket round the corner. Good staff, breakfast vouchers. Luggage storage. All round GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BentleyTravelFreak
Reviews.Content: This was a great hostel to stay in! It was dirt cheap but very safe and owned by a beautiful hotel (that's where you check in) The rooms were basic, but that's what my travel buddies were aiming for. We spent so much time out in Rome that the basicness of the room was all we needed. REALLY close to the main train station and the hotel that runs the property offers a reduced rate bus tour in most langauges. It was really good and a great afternoon overview of the area!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra few bucks and get the private ensuite”
Reviews.Author: socaljsb
Reviews.Content: Before I found out I was going to have an additional traveller on my trip, I had originally reserved a spot in the hostel portion of Hotel/Hostel des Artistes, which runs Carlito's Way. We ended up reserving a private double with shared bath, which at the time was significantly cheaper than the private ensuite. Upon arrival to a dark and rainy Rome, we made our way to Hotel des Artistes to check in (the check in/lobby area is on the fifth floor). During the check in process we offered a room with private ensuite bath for a discounted price for the second night of our stay, which we are glad we did. After checking in, we were led a couple blocks north to an annex which was located in one of the three buildings that house the Hotel des Artiste/Carlito's Way rooms. The room was sufficient, nothing luxurious, but it provided a place to sleep and the shared bath was directly across the hall and was usually never occupied which was nice. During the day after our first night, our bags were moved by the staff to our new room in a building next to the main building and we found the new accomodations much more luxurious. A flat screen tv mounted on the wall at the foot of the bed, a spotlessly clean bathroom, and efficient air conditioner were welcomed. The use of three buildings keeps the exact location of your room a secret until you arrive, but they are all within a few minutes walk of the main building. Each building has a lift, which makes lugging heavy bags much easier. The main building is a few blocks from Rome's Termini train station and metro, which makes travelling much more convenient, although Rome is better explored on foot. The staff were very welcoming and went out of their way to help us feel comfortable. Overall, the private ensuite rooms of Carlito's Way are Highly Recommended. However, if your main concern is your budget, the rooms with shared bath will serve you well as a base for showering and sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Carlito's Way”
Reviews.Author: barbRev
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Carlito's Way, and would happily recommend it to friends. Carlito's Way is spacious and quite. With the Soviet Embassy next door, security is not an issue! BJ, Winnipeg, CANADA

Reviews.Title: “carlito's way was great -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It made us want to extend our stay in rome for a lot longer! comfortable, spacious, clean rooms and friendly staff - i couln't ask for more! we had just arrived from a disastrous stay in anacapri and it was your hospitality and romes amazing culture and history that made our trip all better again! justin and melanie, cape town, south africa

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Or first night was had a shared bathroom, and the toilet broke. The pressure in the shower was also next to non-existant. After we upgraded to a more expensive room that had air-conditioning, things were fantastic! The staff is helpful, and they have computers to use the internet on for free during certain hours of the day. There is also a nice rooftop garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, very friendly staff, free internet access (very good idea). Nice roof terrace. Enjoyed our stay. P.C (Essex, England)

Reviews.Title: “Carlito's Way - a nice, clean and centrally located hotel/hostel”
Reviews.Author: Riomaravilha
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at Carlito's Way. It is centrally located, the staff is kind and helpful and the prices were good for Rome. They also offer discounts for paying in cash which is a real plus. The bathroom to room ratio is good (if you are sharing one like we did) so you don't need to wait hours to take a shower. And the showers are hot as well:) We stayed in the building on Villafranca (because they have a few buildings in the area) and found it to be quiet and pleasant. The Metro is also nearby as well as Termini. Very convenient and I will return (as soon as I save up enough money to get back to Europe!!).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights last weekend. We had a double room which was very nice, with new furniture. Only one side of the matras was not very good, but I slept ok. There were 5 rooms with one bathroom on the floor, it was cleaned everyday. The shower did not give a lot of water but it was enough. The location is very good, 5 minutes walk from the train station and only 200m or so from the metro! I was a bit worried about the area before arriving there, there absolutely no problem, there are 2 supermarkets very close by, I would stay there again! The people at the reception next door were friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Carlito's Way Hotel and Hostel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Villafranca 10, 00185 Rome, Italy
